trial_identification.studytitle: Efficacy of a physical activity program and typical advice about physical activity in cancer cachexia patients
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The efficacy of physical activity program and typical advice about physical activity in improving the physical activity in cancer cachexia patients.

interventions.interventions: Participants will be provided with a one-on-one training session at the National Cancer Institute, Cairo, Egypt that will include a discussion of each participant's belief in his or her ability to be physically active and physical activity preferences. These sessions will be supervised by physiotherapists. Participant will undertake a 12 week physical activity program that will be tailored to suit the ability of each participant. The exercise program will be guided by Exercise Guidelines for Cancer of the American College of Sports Medicine.The general program that will be individualised for each participant will include three sessions per week, each session 30 minutes. Each session will involve aerobic exercise, balance and flexibility exercises. Balanced exercises as standing on one foot and flexibility exercises as shoulder and upper arm stretch and yoga. The aerobic exercise will include different modes of training ( walking, cross training, jogging and cycling) for 20-30 minutes, of an intensity of 40%-70% of predicted heart maximum rates or 8-13 on the 15-point Borg's scale for rating of perceived of exertion. It is unexpected that cancer cachexia patients will be able to do jogging or cycling but every patient will have individualised modes of training according to their ability. All the program will be under direct supervision of physiotherapist so we will be able to monitor adherence to the intervention.
interventions.comparator: Control group will not receive any intervention program.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The ability of the patients to perform daily physical activities independently as measured by Katz Index and Physical Performance Test questionnaire as the data will be collected at baseline and again after 12 weeks
The ability of the patient to perform daily physical activities independent as measured by Katz Index questionnaire.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Data will be collected at base line after 4 weeks from intervention, for both control and intervention group.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The ability of the patient to perform daily physical activities independently as measured by Physical Performance Test questionnaire.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Data will be collected for both the control group and intervention group at the base line 4 weeks after recruitment .

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The effect of the physical activity program on the psychological well being. We will use the Centre for Epidemiological Studies Depression Inventory (CES-D) .

The effect of the physical activity program on the quality of life we will use the European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer core quality of life Questionnaire (EORTC Q-C 30, version 3).

The effect of the physical activity program on the objective physical functioning of cancer cachexia. We will use 6 minute walk test, sit to stand (30 seconds) and Godin Shephard-Leisure- Time Exercise Questionnaire .

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Eligible cases will be adult males or females who have non-small cell lung cancer, small cell lung cancer, colon cancer, cervical cancer, ovarian cancer or endometrial cancer with cancer cachexia.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Patients who have the same type of cancer but do not have cancer cachexia.

trial_design.statisticalmethods: Interim analysis is to be conducted following the 1st 30 participants.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The study is randomised controlled trial to check the efficacy of an intervention physical activity program to increase physical activity levels and improve psychological well-being , quality of life and objective physical functioning outcomes among cancer cachexia.
